title: Christian women in Oak Ridge area to hear about YWCA transitional housing
description: Katherine Burnette, of the YWCA Knoxville and the Tennessee Valley, will provide information on the organization's Transitional Housing Program
content:
Ladies of Oak Ridge and the surrounding area are invited to an upcoming luncheon program titled, "Finding Joy in the Midst of Change."

It will be held at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, 215 S. Illinois Ave., Oak Ridge, from 11 a.m.to 1 p.m. Tuesday, Sept. 9. The featured guest speaker will be Katherine Burnette, of the YWCA Knoxville and the Tennessee Valley, who will provide information on the organization's Transitional Housing Program, according to a news release.

She will be followed by the inspirational speaker for the day: Cindy Leihkauff. She is a retired teacher from Clinton, who is known for her writing, singing, storytelling, and acting programs in the area. She will share her personal message about facing the twilight years with grace and joy, which she titles, "A Wrinkle in Time."

Invite a friend, and make your reservations by noon Friday, Sept. 5, to Debbie at 865-323-3973 or Roena at 865-806-1071. The total cost of the luncheon and program is $20, which includes tax and tip. Please remember that reservations must be honored.

Free preschool childcare is available with reservations. These monthly luncheons are presented by the Oak Ridge Christian Women's Connection, which is nondenominational and associated with Stonecroft Ministries.

This article originally appeared on Oakridger: Christian women in area to hear about YWCA transitional housing
summary: The ladies of Oak Ridge and the surrounding area are invited to a luncheon program titled "Finding Joy in the Midst of Change" at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel on Tuesday, September 9. The featured guest speaker will be Katherine Burnette from the YWCA Knoxville and the Tennessee Valley, who will provide information about the organization's Transitional Housing Program. The luncheon and program costs $20.
shortSummary: Ladies in the Oak Ridge area are invited to a luncheon featuring Katherine Burnette and Cindy Leihkauff to discuss the YWCA's transitional housing program.

Christian women in Oak Ridge area to hear about YWCA transitional housing
Retired teacher from Clinton to provide inspiration on getting older
Ladies of Oak Ridge and the surrounding area are invited to an upcoming luncheon program titled, "Finding Joy in the Midst of Change."
It will be held at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, 215 S. Illinois Ave., Oak Ridge, from 11 a.m.to 1 p.m. Tuesday, Sept. 9. The featured guest speaker will be Katherine Burnette, of the YWCA Knoxville and the Tennessee Valley, who will provide information on the organization's Transitional Housing Program, according to a news release.
She will be followed by the inspirational speaker for the day: Cindy Leihkauff. She is a retired teacher from Clinton, who is known for her writing, singing, storytelling, and acting programs in the area. She will share her personal message about facing the twilight years with grace and joy, which she titles, "A Wrinkle in Time."
Invite a friend, and make your reservations by noon Friday, Sept. 5, to Debbie at 865-323-3973 or Roena at 865-806-1071. The total cost of the luncheon and program is $20, which includes tax and tip. Please remember that reservations must be honored.
Free preschool childcare is available with reservations. These monthly luncheons are presented by the Oak Ridge Christian Women's Connection, which is nondenominational and associated with Stonecroft Ministries.

argos_summary: Oak Ridge Christian women are invited to a luncheon on Sept. 9 at the DoubleTree by Hilton to learn about the YWCA Knoxville's Transitional Housing Program. Katherine Burnette will discuss the program, followed by retired teacher Cindy Leihkauff who will share a message on aging with grace. The event costs $20, includes childcare, and requires reservations by Sept. 5.
